summary: Adwait Loop: a client-first daily logic puzzle game designed for 365 days of engagement, with deterministic client-side puzzle generation/validation, offline IndexedDB progress, streak/heatmap motivation, and a minimalist backend for auth, user stats, and top-100 daily leaderboards.
architectural_notes: Client-first architecture: puzzle generation, gameplay logic, hint limits, and solution validation run entirely on the client.
Deterministic puzzle generation seeded by date (and potentially user) to ensure consistency without server puzzle storage.
Offline-first with IndexedDB for daily progress and local state; game remains fully functional without internet.
Minimal backend (Node/Express + Prisma + Neon Postgres) stores only essential user/stats and top-100 daily scores; no puzzle content stored server-side.
Frontend stack target: React 18+, Redux Toolkit, Tailwind + Styled Components, Framer Motion, Day.js, crypto-js.

existing_features.title: Create the core app shell for “Logic Looper” with a home screen that shows today’s puzzle status (locked/unlocked/complete), current streak, and primary actions: Play Today, Practice (optional), Leaderboard, Achievements, Settings.

Implement deterministic, date-seeded daily puzzle selection and generation on the client: for any local calendar date, choose one puzzle type from the rotating set and generate a reproducible puzzle instance from a stable seed derived from that date.

Provide at least 3 playable puzzle types in the rotating system (from: Number Matrix/Sudoku-like, Sequence Solver, Pattern Matching, Deduction Grid, Binary Logic) with interactive UI, clear rules, and client-side solution validation for each implemented type.
Add a daily progression system that unlocks a new puzzle at local midnight and maintains a 365-day calendar view showing completion history as a heatmap-style activity visualization.

Implement offline-first persistence using IndexedDB for: daily puzzle state/progress, completion result, hints used today, streak history, achievements, and local settings; gameplay must work fully without network connectivity.
Add a streak and scoring system computed client-side: track consecutive-day completions, last played date, and daily score (including optional time bonus when timed mode is enabled).
Implement a client-managed hint system with a limited number of hints per day (reset at local midnight) and per-puzzle hint interactions that do not require backend calls.

Implement progressive difficulty adjustment on the client: adjust parameters of generated puzzles over time based on the user’s recent performance (e.g., streak, solve time, hint usage, win/loss), while keeping the daily puzzle deterministic for a given user and date.

Add “Guest Mode” as the default local-only experience and integrate Internet Identity for optional sign-in; signing in should enable syncing only the minimal data needed for leaderboards and cross-device continuity (without breaking offline play).

Implement the frontend leaderboard screen that fetches daily top-100 from the backend when online, shows the user’s rank if present, and clearly indicates offline/unsynced state when not connected or not signed in.

Add “Friend Challenge” sharing via URL by encoding a shareable puzzle state payload (puzzle type + seed/date + optional starting state) into the URL; opening the link loads the same puzzle instance client-side without requiring backend storage.
Implement a client-side achievements/badges system (e.g., streak milestones, no-hint win, speed win) with an Achievements screen and persistent unlock tracking stored locally.

Apply a coherent, polished visual theme across the app (typography, spacing, color palette, component styling) suitable for a modern daily puzzle game; avoid blue/purple as the primary palette and ensure consistent styling across all screens.
Add generated static image assets for branding and UI accents, store them under frontend/public/assets/generated, and render them in the UI (e.g., app header, empty states, achievements).
Generate a new brand logo mark that is a clean, standalone “A” logo and a matching wordmark for the app name “Adwait Loop”, and store them as static assets under frontend/public/assets/generated.
Update the app header branding in frontend/src/components/AppShell.tsx to use the new “A” logo and “Adwait Loop” wordmark assets (including updating the img alt text accordingly).

Update remaining visible app branding strings from “Logic Looper” to “Adwait Loop” in user-facing UI locations surfaced in the current codebase (at minimum: Home page welcome header, footer copyright label, and the browser tab title in frontend/index.html).

new_feature_requests.summary: Daily rotating logic puzzles (multiple puzzle types) with deterministic date-seeded generation and client-side solution validation
365-day daily engagement system: midnight unlock/reset (local time), streak counter, and year-long activity heatmap
Progressive difficulty that auto-adjusts based on user performance
Optional timed challenge mode with extra rewards
Client-managed hint system with limited hints per day
Offline-first support with IndexedDB progress saving and full offline gameplay
Authentication: Google OAuth 2.0, Truecaller integration, and guest mode (local-only)
Social/competitive: daily leaderboards (top 100 sync only), friend challenges via shareable URL puzzle state, and client-side achievements/badges

Build a minimalist Motoko backend that stores and serves daily leaderboards (top 100 per date) and basic per-user stats keyed by principal; provide query/update methods for: submitScore(date, score, timeTaken, puzzleType), getLeaderboard(date), and getMyStats().
Rebrand app from “Logic Looper” to “Adwait Loop” and update branding assets (logo to an “A” mark) across UI
